title: Designing Elementary English Teaching Methods Using Mixed Research Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Basic English Grammar and Communication Skills
context.additional_context: Need to strengthen practical English education for professionals, considering smartphone-centered learning in limited technological environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain English lesson design processes using a mixed-methods approach (sequential explanatory design).
Learners can present three or more strategies for enhancing 21st-century competencies in elementary English education.
Learners can develop at least two types of effective online English lesson materials in resource-constrained technological environments.
Learners can design assessment systems to address practical problems in EFL (English as a Foreign Language) educational settings.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
